div.p: NARRATOR: Suppose Pat drinks on occasion, and when he does, it's typically between one and two drinks a day.
NARRATOR: Overall, research indicates that one or two drinks per day does not increase risk for most people.
NARRATOR: Many studies show that people who on average drink between one and two per day may live longer than either abstainers or those drinking three or more.
NARRATOR: This seems to be due primarily to a reduction in risk for coronary heart disease.
NARRATOR: However, the small decrease in mortality at this level isn't so great that any happy abstainer should start drinking for health benefits.
